Hi Greg. I'm the OM from the pioneer valley office in MA. I wish in this survey I could add comments to each question. I love this company and always put 110% into my job, but the last month or so has been crazy with all of the changes and last minute notices. I'm short staffed and now feeling micromanaged. I also feel sales Reps need to be more accountable as just like the rest of us as a team. We are all heading in the right direction but at the end we all need to be On the same page. Also with the all new changes including safety we need to take it into consideration of how install will take longer. I could go on but it would be a book. That being said I love the company and can't wait to see what 2015

They only reason I replied as not feeling part of the company is because I feel there is a disconnect between departments  such as CAD, Processing and the corporate office in Lehi, I have worked here for 2 years now and I feel we have gone downhill in my time being here.
As a non sales person 8 months ago sometimes I feel my lack of production (not for lack of trying) stresses me to produce at any cost which does not produce good accounts

I love Vivint what it stands for and how it does it, I have been encouraged as a firefighter to create and go out to teach firefighters how to safely work on the systems, I couldn't ask for a better team put In the pioneer valley

I love working for Vivint Solar. I want to make a career here. Vivint solar has given me opportunities I would not have gotten other places. I work in Orem in the operations department. \\The reason I"m concerned with the direction of the company is because our numbers are way down. Our conversion rate from sale to PTO is getting worse not better. With all the changes we are making our ability to move accounts forward is not improving. IT had made managing accounts much more difficult. Everything that IT rolls out is a nightmare and makes my job more difficult. After a new IT item rolls out my coworkers and I have to spend the next several weeks fixing the process IT just broke. \\We can overcome these challenges. The recent change of moving Andrew Walton over processing is a move in the right direction.

I work in processing. Andrew Walton the new director is great. I believe he will improve the department over time. \\Processing touches almost all parts of the company. The issue that most applies to this page is, that when processes are changed or implemented company wide processing and most other groups who will have to execute the process are not brought in until the end. When it is to late to take their input to improve the new or changed processes. If you want buy in across the company the various groups need to buy in must be heard before you ask them to buy in. You don't need to do what they want or get consensus but the groups need to give their input and be heard. An example of this is the recent As-built to FIN process. The teams in the field are not following the process. They are not following the process because they were not included at all in planning, creating and implementing the process. Its not easy to implement new processes correctly but failure to do so is very costly.

IT is an issue. It seems to be the case that IT is the final arbitrator when it comes to designing and implementing business processes that my group and other groups are responsible for and must execute on a daily basis. This results in deeply flawed processes that require workarounds and drain our company of resources. The most costly resource we loss is good people who get burned out and lose confidence in our company.
This is a gold rush and we have to make bold moves to stay on top of the opportunity, however I've seen cannonballs fired before bullets in many cases (such as  PCCF)
there seems to be a weak component in securing warehouses.
Vivint solar year end concert? I hear Miley Cyrus loves solar.

I have been very optimistic and devoted to the company in times past but struggle to do so now. There has been so much confusion lately about the new processes, who is supposed to do what, and disappointed customers who have been left behind while the local office struggles to get things done right and in a timely manner.\Many older accounts are left in the dust, while newer accounts get the attention. I think the oldest account, that has been waiting for a long time, should have their work done first. The local office takes way too long to follow up with undone work.\With the new CSM position, we were told that the pay would be high, and our status would be at a manager level. When I was offered the position, I was told that because of the merger the pay would be lower. This was a disappointment. My experience since then has been extremely stressful. Almost everyday there are processes that don't work correctly. Every week my Google Doc isn't correct. I have 150ish accounts that I need to contact every week with no overtime allowed. The majority of my accounts are stuck in ESC processes or don't have the As Built done and require a lot of follow up. The Tech's continue to not send in all the needed photos on a regular basis. \The work load is not humanly possible, and yet the accountability is still there. On an ongoing basis, we continue to find out that we are responsible for more and more that other departments used to do ie canceling accounts, re-activating accounts, website help, generating system ID's, building the systems in Enphase and Solar Edge, activating accounts at PTO, etc.\I feel a CSM should be able to tap into the other departments to help us take care of the customer, not take over the other departments responsibilities, in addition to the many we already have.\Most of the time, we just suddenly discover we have one more thing we need to do, but have not received any notification or training for it, and the departments that used to do the task won't help. So much is unsettled and instead of getting better, it gets worse.\Many times I have hung in there for company transitions, I have no problem with that when there is hope at the end of the tunnel that a brighter day is coming soon. Lately, I feel so beaten down and disrespected. The pay does not come close to the intense work load that keeps ever increasing. The mountain is too high to climb because of the chaos. The As Built to FIN has made little difference in my office. The main problems still exist, EWO's and IWO's are not completed on a regular basis, the local office doesn't have enough Electricians for the work load, the Work Orders department is not getting things done in a timely manner and our missing As Built list is huge.\I felt so optimistic and had high hopes for things to evolve. Now I feel so beaten down. Everyone on my team has similar feelings, and because of the extremely high stress, many of us have been getting sick for some time now.\\With the merger, we are all very anxious to know how this will affect us. We have an interest in knowing how close we are, November was the last date mentioned. What can we anticipate in regards to the Health Insurance, especially with the Vivint Clinic access ending. What's the progress on the new buildings? In order to stay excited about change, we need more information about how things are moving along. This way we feel like we are still on the train to somewhere, instead of forgotten.\I want to stay because I have a great team, and they make it worth it. The truth is, my mind wanders to other possibilities because it feels like I'm on a sinking ship. \We really do treat many of our customer's terribly. As a CSM, our hands are often tied because we can't offer more than what the local office will do.\I wish we could stop the Installs for a week, so we could focus on the all the backlog to get a fresh start in serving our customer's in a timely manner. I would like to see more company integrity.

Please define department responsibilities clearly\Please provide a document that we can all access with company wide information, in one place\Please let CSM's better care for our customer's by having other departments do what they do best\Please pay us better for the hard work we do; what we were led to believe\Please keep us informed how our lives will be affected by the merger; insurance, new location, etc\\We wouldn't have our jobs without the Sales Rep's, and they wouldn't be able to make a sale without the work we do. We are important and need to feel appreciated in ways that matter.
Working for this company has provided me with financial security and a sense of pride that no other job has. We are changing the world in a way that will benefit all of man kind and the earth.

Out meeting do a great job of telling us what's happening in the headlines but not what is happening within our office or with changes in company policy. We know about the stuff customers could ask about but not how policies are changing from week to week

I hope that everyone has a great holiday, thanks for making my job possible. Let's keep changing the world for the better, let's all work to make it easier and more efficient for customers to go solar.

The transitions between the different needs  of reps tools, clients, and employees between the departments  are a bit worrysome. Many of us keep a possitive attitude because we believe in green energy however it's not running as smooth as expected...and expectations are high today.

The reps are out there in rain and sunshine and we depend on their work for our salaries aswell. There needs to be a stronger respect were the $$ is coming from so that office people will do their part to move the work forward.

Right now, particularly as a work order processpr, a lot of us feel thrown under the bus. We're overloaded, understaffed for the types of projects that are flung at us (along cleaning and back to school) and we've got delay after delay and problem after problem with the rollout of new procedures and policies with little communication between departments. CSM's in particular have thrown a huge wrench into our workings at the worst possible time for our backlog due to poor understanding of what they do, and what us processors do. As well, though it's understood that everything with a merger is either "I don't know, not until later, I can't promise anything" and lots of bad news about Sun Edison. There's a lot of gossip and not a lot of input from our leadership about what's going on ( frankly, because they might now know themselves.) Despite all of this, I'm proud to work here! I love my job and the opportunities Vivintsolar provides!

I think it would be great if we continued our monthly leadership meetings. Great information and was a great opportunity to learn about what other departments do. \\Still a strong perception that sales is the superior organization (higher pay, more SWAG/Incentives,etc.). \\There needs to be more of a team mentality between departments. We are one team with one purpose.\\Need champions from the exec team to support the safety program.

I feel that vivintsolar was founded on the ideal to produce clean energy, saving people money and saving the world but with so many changes, especially in the CAD department, I feel like its not only slowing the process but it's causing inaccuracies and costing the customer more money rather than saving them money. I do love working here but I feel like almost every day is a different change in the process and I feel that not only am I cut off from information and changes but my team leads and supervisor as well are not receiving information they need.  This is an amazing company to work for and I am always excited to tell people that I'm helping to save the world, but I just hope that we are doing everything to help and not harm.

I know what my job is and I am confidant that I do it well and efficiently. Most of the resources that I do need are available but every now and then I run into a problem that is dealt by a different department but still as a CAD designer I should know how to properly deal with the problem rather then pass it off to someone else. I honestly have no clue what is expected this next quarter for the company, I do not know how well this company is doing or even who we're partnered. I have heard rumors flying around here and there but nothing solid. My fellow employees are committed to a point. They do their jobs and reach expectations but there is nothing that really drives or pushes them. There is nothing intrinsic about their motivation and the recent incentives have really only focused on singular people and for a short period of time. That's great if you want to reach numbers for a certain week, but you can't always run at 110% if you want to reach a quarterly goal. With constant changes it's difficult to keep one goal because some changes can completely change how you work. My supervisor does keep me well informed on a lot of things but there are some questions that I have asked that not even he could answer, he would tell me that he has not received information on that so it's unclear on how we would move forward in certain situations. I feel that there are too many people being left in the dark about a lot of stuff or information is being passed around too much and it just becomes a game of telephone and a "that's what he said" situation. I used to receive information about what was going on in the company and it made me excited to know that what I was doing is worth it and that the fight for clean energy was going somewhere but in recent times, I haven't received anything. I would also like to know if our solar panels have really helped someone. Just like how vivint security would send out emails about how customers thanked and appreciated them, I think it would be nice to receive something like that about vivint solar. Knowing that I'm making a difference and seeing that I'm helping people really drives me to work harder.

I am a CAD technician and I have been with the company for almost a year now, within the time I have worked here I have actually been able to learn and grow, and also become the fastest designer on my team. I owe all of what I learned to my trainers, supervisors and team leads and I thank vivintsolar for giving me the training and opportunity to become an efficient CAD designer. \\There has been a point in my career where I started to wonder if what i had been doing really mattered, or if I was really just someone who could be easily replaced. The latter is still true but I do love this job so I hope I'm not replaced, but when I first started I loved pushing myself, seeing how much work I could get done, what my fastest CAD was, how much work with so few mistakes I could get finished and it went pretty well. I became the fastest designer on my team but with just those bragging rights it started to feel like that's all I was, just a good worker, my motivation started to drop and my work suffered but I looked to see what else I could do and what else I could learn. I read the books Drive and A Whole New Mind by Daniel pink and I started branching out to see what else I could do to help my team. I started learning some electrical, answering phones and emails, doing redesigns, and many other things. I noticed that not very many people in my department have that intrinsic motivation to do work, to challenge yourself, and I know a lot of the higher ups noticed it too and did incentives. The incentives worked for short term goals but either the department ran out of money for the incentive or people were just not pushed by them, when they were done, a lot of people just slipped back into old habits. I feel like this job and company is very team and goal oriented but it feels more like it's concentrated on a singular persons success rather then a team.\\I used to work with vivint security and the things that really stuck with me most was their sayings like "One team, one goal" and "Be better today then you were yesterday, be better tomorrow then you are today". I don't really feel that comradery here, I feel more isolated and that a lot of people are left in the dark about the goings on in the company. As a CAD designer we prep all of the packets to be sent to the customer and permitting. About a month ago I had an electrical training to see how much I know about the electrical because we design the three lines and some of the electrical for every system. Most people in that training had no idea what went into a design electrically, the trainer that was a head electrician for vivintsolar seemed almost astounded that we are designing things that we had no idea about. I feel like that shouldn't happen. \\I've heard rumors about vivintsolar and that's what I really hope they just are, is rumors. I do love working for this company, I'm excited to see where it's going, amazed by how fast it's grown, and happy that I'm able to be a part of this clean energy movement. I'm still striving for success and am always glad to come in to work. Thank you for this amazing opportunity.

I love what we are doing. Even though we are large and growing the executives are putting/promoting a lot of the right people to support us. I am proud to be here with VSLR and hope to see us continue to fight for greatness.
we are having a lot of personnel changes with our OM and OAs so there is a lot of growing pains, but overall things are going well.

It gives me great pleasure to be a part of this revolution not only are we helping the environment, we are including our residence to be a part of it as well and that gives me great pleasure. In my years in the work force I have never had a better team of leaders as we have in Stockton. "Jason & Clint"
I reall love working at Vivint. As a sales professional I feel that my contributions are valued. I also work with an amazing group of people and grow while learning from them.

I have been amazed at how transparent and well ordered the communication process is at Vivint. There is however a disparity in the sense of urgency within certain departments. Often times I run into road blocks with processing. But for the most part, people are working hard and are enthusiastic about there work.

Just a shout out to the CAD department. Despite a heavy work load, they are super easy to contact and are very patient with our requests. This is really the best company I have worked for. My family and I are glad we made the switch.

The only direction i am a little concerned about is the design stuff that has recently been introduced. I understand why they are making us get everything signed before a CAD design but when I worked for sun edison and others that had really clunky processes it was similar to the directions we are going with it. I just don't sell intellectually and so I don't talk about savings or how much their new bill is going to be. Its just cheaper cleaner energy! The biggest issue with having them sign everything before the CAD is that they aren't mentally there yet and it gives me time to get them there! All other areas we are going is awesome though. I love vivint solar and it is the best opportunity i have seen in my life time. thanks for all you do!

We do a great job in the communication department and our office and team are bought into be better people and leading the revolution. even though our thousand oaks office is rebuilding, we have great leadership and communication is awesome.

I feel that the company is amazing and at the front of a real life revolution. I will look back in 30 years and say to my kids and grandkids that i was apart of that! We have great leadership and i appreciate all the handwork and unseen hours that they put in to make this opportunity what it is! So now for what i would change or be careful of in the future is being something we are not! The reason I came to VSLR from Sun Edison and Complete Solar was because of process and how I sell. I sell very conceptually! I don't talk about savings, panel size, inverter type, or any of that stuff! It cripples consumers when guys do that! Customers start becoming analyzers! And then before you know it they get analysis paralysis!! i.e. "let me think about it!" We will sell more if we train our guys better on this concept. I am worried about doing design tools and putting to much in the hands of sales reps like programs to design and show the customer what it will look like! It will not help customers make decisions and will only provide a crutch to average or below average salesman! I have seen it first hand with complete solar and how it hurt guys that with a little better skills would of been great! I don't use slicks and i don't use videos or graphs cause that is not how people choose or buy. They just want to know it is the right decision and feel good about it! They will buy off of emotion and sell themselves after you leave because it makes sense. More info only confuses them more! Anyway this is an amazing company and I am so grateful to be apart of it! It is and will continue to change my life and the people around me! 31G!!!
My warehouse went from the worst in the company to one of the best especially for 6 trucks or more and we have received no recognition for making it so.
I receive my information from the operations side and usually inform my supervisor of upcoming changes
There are to many individuals in key supervisory positions that are in their early or mid twenty's and have no clue on how to manage or supervise people.

I am proud to do the work that we do, but would like to see a more committed effort to the sustainability of the entire process. In specific, I feel that more emphasis could be focused on the recycling of our waste products including cardboard, steel, and alluminum. When I see these materials discarded in the trash daily it irritates me since I know that a great deal of energy and raw materials go into the manufacturing of such products. As a leader in the renewable energy industry, it is doing a diservice to allow for such actions to take place. I do understand that we have the ability in most cases to recycle these products, but have found that the process is being compromised due to factor that are unexpected. Perhaps an incentive program or something of the alike could be put in place to emphasis a focus on issue. Thanks for the opportunity to voice my concern. Hopefully we can continue to improve upon the great path that we are on.

Working in sales has been up and down as anyone would expect with a sales job. I feel extremely valuable to the company. I have felt that as a company, Vivint solar does try so hard to make my job easier and more efficient. I have been with the company for 2 years now and I have seen great movements forward. I trust the leadership and the direction that the company has chosen. Somethings that make me nervous though has been our operations turn over and customer support after I hand them off to corporate. I would have put strongly agree if I trusted what's happening with the operations more. I was an operations manager with Vivint.inc. I always try to see both sides of the workforce, I feel like being in the operations side to be risky and not necessarily fair. The work load put on OM's needs to be spread out better. In Bmore we have have gone through 5 OM's in the 2 years we have been open. I know this has not been unique to our office. Operations turn over is high. On another note, they are often pressured to do work that is dangerous. I.e. Install in the rain and snow.  I helped the techs do a install on a good day and it was hard to take panels up a latter. When it's wet it's even more dangerous. Me personally I would never accept those working orders and I would not want a friend or family member to be a installer. If we called more jobs because of bad weather I would have much more faith in the company. I have had several customers that are stressed sick watching our crews work under those conditions, I have had a tech fall off a icy roof. Another tech slice his leg open because a deck was wet and the later slipped. I didn't  vocalize these concerns to anyone before because I didn't think I would be heard. Seems like we are install, install, install. Which is good. But safety first so we don't wreck some of our employees ability to work in the future because injury.
Quarter quotas have been so out of our reach a lot of us just ignore them. I used to pay closer attention to them. But for the last 3 quarters I have lost touch with the company goals

The i The first year started the company culture was amazing. I couldn't stop talking it up to every one, customer, family, friends. It was so much fun, every month there was activities as a region or office the involved the whole family. \2015 has been ok, but definitely a lot less focused on the whole family, and also less focus on the team. The top performers have been getting a lot of exclusive treatment. I feel like our synergy as a company and individual offices has been negatively impacted for this culture change. \In my mind I can hear myself saying "anyone can point out problems, leaders provide solutions." \I say we get back to the basics. Every quarter, have a wife's night out where they send the wife's out on the town. When we first started that was the norm. Now it's stopped.\Every quarter, have a office family activity. I.e. Pool party, Christmas party, office bbq. No stings attached, if your part of the team, your family is invited.  \This job is not a job about being super talented, it's a job about having emotional and mental health. I find that these type of activities provide a getaway from the stressful parts of the job and give a jump start on success. Not to mention how good of a recruiting tool they are when introducing people to the job.
Need to make changes to sales leadership and also how they are paid.
I do like the enthusiasm of the managers, in the concord area we need better communication with installers and surveyors
all the glitches of the digital forms from Apollo are a bit frustrating , we need better communication about resolving holds in accounts
I'm talking some time off to do a Vipassana meditation retreat in the sierras, I believe I would be a more organize worker and consequently more profitable for the company
Love the vision of what we're doing and will do.  I've never worked with better leadership who know how to have fun, yet motivate me to reach for the stars!  Love my job!!

The only frustration is when policy changes, or is added that causes delays for installs, i.e. Structural reviews adding structural cases and we do not have the crews to execute the construction upgrades, our files are on hold and go nowhere and we risk losing our customers.  In the year and a half I've worked here,  I have never seen so many structural "issues" clog up my pipeline.  Someone has become over zealous with their analysis and their "holds".
Overall,  keep doing what you're doing.  We are truly changing the world and I just hope we don't lose politically to the power companies like what happened in Vegas.
Recently we learned of "layoffs" made at Vivint Solar. I am concerned for my job security.

Overall, I would say that I really enjoy it here at vivint. solar. There are times when I'm not quite kept in the loop with what is going on with my team, my team is good at informing me, but my manager/supervisor often forgets.
Great company, great product and most important great people!

I love putting money back into peoples' pockets rather than convincing them that my product will only cost them a few dollars each month.  I love making a difference for them financially long-term with the increased value of the contract due to the projected price differential over time.  I love sharing the vision of our children's future with them, and creating one-on-one relationships with them so they feel like I'm a friend in a discussion, not a salesperson with an agenda.  I can find common ground and share and cultivate their passion about the financial aspect, the reduced weight on the grid, and/or the global impact in this small setting.  Regarding "moving in the right direction," I have never really been comfortable with global monopolies, so the merger has never really felt as comfortable.  However, if we can continue to positively impact individuals' lives while being part of a more global company, then I can work with and continue to be passionate about this.

In my humble opinion and limited experience, the company has no sense of urgency to get from installation to production.  40% of our installed accounts are in DataComm Failure -- just 2 weeks ago it was 70%.  I see this as a *system problem* -- either that department is understaffed, not equipped with the tools necessary to see the problems and respond efficiently, or the company doesn't make enough on production to invest the resources (people/equipment).  This reflects directly on me personally, since the customers have become my friends as well as my sources of referrals.  And it reflects on the bottom line for VivintSolar, since referrals take 1/2 the time to generate and 1/2 the effort to convince, resulting in higher numbers for the company.  So it is counter intuitive to cut corners in the last step.  \This dovetails into my comments regarding knowing what we need to do this quarter.....I know that I need to sell.  I know that the success of the company depends on me getting sales into and through the funnel to installation.  I get sales by creating relationships with people excited about using solar (for whatever reason).   I thought the company was committed to getting solar working, but my numbers of working systems versus DataComm Failures don't reflect that yet.  This currently doesn't appear to be the company's focus, therefore I must not comprehend what is necessary for the company to succeed this or any quarter.  Are we in this for the federal tax credits and RECs, or for the $$ AND making a difference by getting working solar on peoples' homes?   \\The software transitions have been a little bumpy out here on the sales edge.  We are excited about the new software's potential, and cringe at it's arrival knowing it's going to be painful debugging.  And we are grateful for the effort to improve our tools.   Here's hoping the next upgrade is around long enough to allow us to get the bugs out and use it a while.  :)\There seem to be some hand-off gaps.....when an account goes without any problems, the "conveyor belt" automated passage through the design process seems to work well and they get through to Structural Review pretty smoothly.  However, any hic-cup or problem (ie partial surveys, usage submitted after site survey completed, etc), the account falls off the conveyor belt and must be watched/hand-carried step by step to ensure completion.  It would be great to find a *system solution* way to re-set the account onto the track and get it back into the automated production line. \\Morale seems a little challenged due to the wage adjustments on installers, site surveyors and leads (I don't know about other offices/departments).  I don't know the hard numbers, but in general, it feels like playing with the big dogs means scraps & crumbs for more of the workers.  Typical large corporation profit numbers games --- increasing the profit margin the easiest way possible -- cutting staff, wages, benefits for those generating the revenue, cutting the denominator, versus increasing the numerator, sales.  I recognize we couldn't generate the revenue without the opportunity provided by the company.    Still seems like VS is cutting it's throat for a few pennies.  As a former HR director, I know how costly employee turn-over is --- and I can only guess that it has been much higher since the wage adjustment.  And I think I can tell from my own numbers that overall productivity may have decreased.  But I don't have enough experience (ie seasonal adjustments/fluxuations) to know definitively.\It is currently 10pm and we just got word from a customer that he got HOA approval.  We want to schedule his install, but no one is answering in the CSM department.  Our CSM's hours are 9-5:30.  It would be helpful to have at least one CSM available (Very experienced one if I could make a suggestion) 8am-10pm local time, since many of our customers work and we often do the admin before and after knocking/appointment hours.

Both myself and my husband are Sales Managers.  I do most of the back-end things while he creates most of the accounts.  I spend hours daily managing the bucket list.....ensuring CAD activity logged, status of permits, HOA requests and interconnect, researching reasons for holds, tracking down emails asking about holds, status checking hold removal, etc.  We have approx 140 total accounts between the two of us at this time, including cancelled and hibernated.  Honestly, I don't believe that any one person can actually track 150 accounts, especially not if you tack on pre-CAD approval responsibility as well.
I feel blessed for this opportunity.
Thanks again for all that you do. It shows through our leadership in the office.

Overall, we have an awesome environment. This is a good place to be right now despite the enormous change we're undergoing. We're making a difference. We just need to get everyone here on board to believe, and become passionate, in the services we provide.

I feel like the vibe is almost so lax that accountability is out the window. It's a very unfortunate thing to see how many under-par designs get through the process with errors. While we have processes in place to make corrections, there aren't really any repercussions in consistent errors. Overall, this is hindering the quality we can provide as a result. \\While we're able to ultimately do our job, there are so many external processes and google-based docs that are being implemented that cause much of the problem we're seeing in quality. We have SalesForce as our primary account managing system; Let's use it to its fullest. Instead we have a plethora of google docs tracking deviations and random scenarios that can be easily, and quickly, captured in a single report throughout SalesForce. There just seems to be a bit of redundancy which causes a bit of stress for some of my designers and causes them to constantly try to remember way to many processes than is ultimately necessary for them to efficiently complete their work on a daily basis.
Please confirm the merger is going through. Employees feel if the merger does not go through is due to bad leadership!

I am worried about the current state of SunEdison, but even more worried that it doesn't seem to be the concern of upper management that the company know what is happening with the company which usually breeds negative rumors and hurts morale.\\I find when I tell people that I work for Vivint Solar, I immediately cringe thinking that they will immediately judge me as a "bro". This brand that is perceived by others makes me feel as though we are not viewed as professional. I believe this will be slightly alleviated by our re-branding to GO Solar, but could be further improved.\\I also feel that it is not a major concern that the "grunts" of the company have input into how the company grows. I know I personally have ideas that would improve and progress the company but those ideas are not considered because of my position, even as a CAD Supervisor.

One issue I find in the CAD Department is that there isn't a sufficient drive to create standardized tools and resources to support our designers. Instead of looking forward to the future, the focus is set solely on the current issues without thinking of how we can prevent problems to come.

I feel a lot of what I have written previously was negative and I wanted to clarify that there are a lot of good values that this company consists of. I truly enjoy working for Vivint Solar and the affect we are having in this county. I see some of the weaknesses we have and I only desire that we quickly realize what they are so we will one day become all that we can be. This won't happen by changes made by the "big wigs" but only with the support and opinion of "the people."

I've worked for Fortune 500 companies, and small successful startups that had turned into multi-billion dollar companies. With that's being said, this is by far the best place I have ever worked. The atmosphere and entire dynamic here have me hoping things keep going in this direction.

I pride myself on my work, so I take it very seriously. I know if I don't complete my work, more than just the guys I work with suffer. The consumer would suffer as well as the potential leads because of me being lackadaisical on any given day. We're given the best tools I feel like, so that we can get everything done in the most efficient way possible. While I'm not sure what the company goals for the month are specifically, I understand each specific task given to me by my supervisors is just as important as the next. I feel most of the guys on our crew would agree with this.

I'm probably one of the few and far between who actually enjoys waking up and coming to work. I love this place and hope to be able to stick with it for a long time. I just hope the corporate side of things become more streamlined to benefit the company to get from install to PTO a lot quicker. I'm not educated on the exact process but I know that making multiple trips out to the consumers-residence to satisfy investors requirements (i.e. photos) puts the end product in a less than desirable position to be referred. We should be able to PTO the consumer to satisfy them asap and button up everything else on a service call within a week or whatever parameters are acceptable. Lastly, I wish it were easier to find out how to get to the next promotion. What's is needed and how to get there.. Almost like a path to success, especially for us employees who want to stay here and move up in the conpany.
I am in and committed. This is an opportunity to do something good for the Earth, that is lucrative for my family when I am successful.

The only resources that would make me more successful are more direct communication so that I know when things like inspections and PTO is scheduled. These two things appear on my calendar, sometimes after the fact which prevents me from keeping my customers in the know. \\In terms of the company's needs to be profitable, I didn't know that the designs that are idle or active would be redesigned by cad if they were on the new jinks panels. If I had known this, I would have hibernated more of them to save that effort. It also relates to the SunEdison merger, but if there is a specific goal within the company that is needed to show value to keep that deal going through, that could motivate me. \As far as fellow employees, I know that there ar folks at my office that are doing an amazing job. Some had been great role models for me to be successful. The 3 DMs at my office are amazing and they all have different strengths.\On the operations side, there have been sloppy or incorrect site surveys that have caused customers to get something different than the design they approved when we met. It is as if they aren't getting exactly what they thought and making a 20 year commitment to that. One of our regular site surveyors was out of town and the person we were loaned from another office had inaccurate measurements on every single survey he took. Luckily, I installed 4 of them, but not without day of install changes that included big discrepancies in the solar power offset.\There have also been a number of sloppy mistakes on install. I went to a customers house and I saw screws hanging through on the eaves which missed the rafters. It was 20 feet up, but noticeable if you know what to look for andirons was on the front of the persons house. I've got several exposed beam jobs I am working on, and I fear the craftsmanship won't be equal to the task.\Company information is regularly sent through. I probably have enough info to keep me happy.

I feel supported in my job. But, when push comes to shove, It is all up to me, I go out there by myself and create accounts and get installs. I was excited about the referral program and have sent out links to many folks, built profiles for customers, and shared it to spread the word.  The feedback I have gotten from customers is that the site is not working and they can't add in referrals. So I've told them They will get $250 if a referral gets installed, which is a premium, but I have to manage it all on my own. So an update on when that will be repaired and operational would be great. As of today I am not telling anyone else about it. \I also wanted to send an email about this to you! Solar city has sponsored Facebook ads that give folks an opportunity to sign a petition regarding the future of net metering in CA. I want to support the rooftop solar industry, but I don't want to support solar city in my fb feed. Could Vivint sponsor something similar to share? The fate of Net metering in California is critical to our success.\I appreciate the opportunity to make money saving the planet with Vivint Solar.
The ambiguity of the acquisition makes it hard to know which direction that we are heading in as a company.

'- Our current IT development is slow and often results in poorly executed products (excluding software from Solar Labs). \- Our data entry is far to manual given the relatively simple nature of the software development that would be required to automate a lot of our processes.\- The installation org does not adequately record or report on the practical application of the designs that are intended to be their guidance.\-  We seem far to eager to adjust our processes based on non specific or trackable feedback from the Sales team. It seems that we should analyze the root causes of a lot of the issues that we see to identify what is causing the issue rather than adjust processes based on hearsay.

'- The total number of site surveys completed and CADs designed have increased while the number of accounts moving to install has remained relatively constant. It seems that a focus on driving more quality accounts as opposed to just more accounts is something that ought to be focused on.

I'm going to be completely honest I feel like a lot of low level management has lost culture .  There is no Relationship building and communication is absolutely horrid. A lot of work has to be done about this or issues will keep happening.  Sometimes I dread coming to work
Like I said I feel that there's a huge gap in communication it really needs to be worked on

Basically all I have to say is since I've worked for the company for the last 24 months I've watched communication culture love come robbery teamwork just turned to crap in my office people try to multitask and do seven things at once and get none of them done and I just feel like it's a different company doesn't have that wonderful feel to it like it once did and you can chop this up as a personal matter and not address it or take it seriously because this is the stuff that matters

With respect to company direction, I am extremely optimistic about the competitive agility (kWh pricing, evolving customer agreements etc...) I have personally experienced in the 2 markets I have worked in (Connecticut & especially Arizona).  As a Sales Manager, knowing that my company is willing and able to adjust to market changes gives me confidence and job satisfaction.  Confidence that I am providing the customer with the most competitive product currently available and job satisfaction that I will be able to continue to do so in the future.  Unfortunately, I am not as optimistic about encouraging family members and friends to work for Vivint Solar (in the sales capacity).  Not because of the product, but because of the barriers the sales culture creates.  You have to be an extremely unique shape to fit in the Vivint Solar sales mold.  I have watched us lose extremely competent sales reps at an alarming rate because of the narrow sales culture.

Normally we have the resources to be succesful.  The 4th quarter AZ CAD back log is going to push at least 100kW into next quarter that easily could have been installed this quarter.  The training AZ CAD is going through on top of having to train new designers crushed their productivity.
Thank you for the opportunity of experiencing the solar "snowball effect" with Vivint Solar.  With a few tweaks, I believe their is the potential of an avalanche of success just waiting to happen.
Alot and lets just leave it that.

Frequently, changes in policy and procedure are not communicated to my team. 90% of the policy changes are learned via word of mouth. I dont think its that hard to send an email out and keep a small team informed of changes that will save us time and money, by avoiding mistakes that will have to be corrected later.

With respect to personal advancement and opportunities to grow, I feel that Vivint Solar is lacking. Having substantial time with this company, I have seen numerous policies regarding raises and promotions implemented, changed, withdrawn, and discarded. Without going into specifics, I feel that  Vivint Solar used to provide its employees with a clear cut policy of how to personally advance through hard work, diligence, and productivity. Raises were assigned based on skill and merit and awarded to those who met the designated requirements. They motivated employees to work harder and hit goals to be rewarded. Currently, I observe an absence of motivation from many employees. There is no recognition or merit based on compensation for someone who goes  beyond the minimum. Sadly, many choose the minimum because the reward is the same for both ends of the spectrum. I really do love this company, and have enjoyed the time I have invested with this company and the vision it posses to provide clean energy to the masses. I simply feel, with a few tweaks, a significant proportion of the workforce could be motivated to perform better, and be compensated for it.

I feel that, people aren't treated fairly. That things aren't dealt with the way they should be, I had my brother apply but they wouldn't hire him because he was trying to be part time. So I wouldn't encourage friends and family to come work here.
The communication in my department isn't great. They don't really communicate with us about anything. I also feel like I'm held to the highest standard on my team but I never get recognized for it.

I really do not understand why we aren't allowed raises, and bigger than .25. It's honestly an insult. I work very hard, and there is no benefit for working this hard. It's frustrating for me to sit here everyday and have the upper management push us and push us, yet they haven't sat in our shoes. I feel like the company just wants numbers and doesn't really care about their employees. I've never worked for a company and felt the way I do. For months I didn't want to come to work because a Co-worker was bullying me, but it was all turned on me and was all my fault. I just don't feel like people take their employees seriously. Everyone isn't treated equally. When my husband was diagnosed with cancer, his supervisor tried to get in contact with hr to be able to get our GoFundMe account emailed out to the company because he wasn't allowed to work very much anymore. We never got an answer back and days later someone else's got sent out. I just don't see the uniform equality here. I like working here it's just frustrating sometimes. \\thanks

Sometimes there are occasions where I wish the company moved a little smoother. And there are times there are things that happen that are not very accommodating all around. I guess you could call it lack of organization at times. But it's a young company and we're still trying to figure things out. Over all I do love the company.

I have been with vivint Solar for about 3 years and have recieved nothing for my efforts. I used to be driven, motivated, and getting better numbers than most others. I started in CAD, then went to pre-design, usage, and not back in Design. All the time the idea of "great opportunity to grow with the company was getting thrown in my face that I kept buying. But I have received nothing but bad luck, crappy and hypocritical leaders (Carter and James especially!) and NO opportunities to grow with the company. I am currently looking for better employment.

If there is one thing I have learned at working for Vivint Solar, that is that the ability to communicate information is awful. I feel like every day there is a change or a miscommunication. How are we as Designers or in any department supposed to find a smooth system to design with if the system is constantly getting changed. Not only that, half the time I am hearing things the first time from co-workers or even people on other teams before I hear anything from my direct supervisor.

To be honest, there are 3 reasons I am currently looking for a new job.\1. Poor leadership. I would say the two people that have rubbed me the wrong way is Carter Howe and James Nelson. Both of them are hypocritical, deceiving, immature, power abusers (almost fired me for something so small and stupid when the majority of the blame should have been my team leads fault) who have sucked up their way to be some of the "top dawgs" in the CAD department. I know they may have great skills that benefit the company and maybe those things are taking precedence, but as an employee under them, it makes my job awful.\2. The lies of opportunity. I have been here for 3 years now and have heard the talk about opportunity from day one. I have tried so hard, spent countless of overtime hours to increase numbers and get more things done. When I was in Pre-design I continually wow'ed my leaders and did my job well, then found out they were dissolving Pre-design, so I switched to CAD (where I was much worse at my job). Then I found out the company just juked me out and did not get rid of predesign but I felt there was more "opportunity with Design, so I stayed and tried to "grow with the company. Nada. No opportunities. Because CAD is full of suck ups and the only way to grow is to be in a click of some sort, or know everything about CAD. (which I don't). \3. the Pay. I have a new born baby. I am trying to provide for my family. When other companies are paying their CAD techs $15-$18 an hour and I only get $12.50 an hour. It's kinda sad. \\I need a job I enjoy, that pays well enough to not live paycheck to paycheck with my son and wife. So I am done here and looking for greater opportunities. As soon as I find that job, I will be gone. My experience with Vivint Solar was not too bad in the beginning over when we were by vivint Inc. But the past year or so has really rubbed me the wrong way and has not been a good or fun experience in employment.
I like working here. I'm good at what I do and my team lead and supervisor always let me know how I'm doing and are always telling me how good I am and how I'm very reliable.

I try to do m work, but my computer is a piece of crap and IT refuses to fix it so I've had to learn to work around the issue. I hear and am constantly seeing my team member not even trying. They've said they don't care so they don't care if they make errors and they don't care that there efficiency is super low. Which gets frustrating for me cause I do care about mine and with them not caring or even trying, things don't get done and I end up doing more than twice the work as everyone else some days

I love working here. I love my supervisor and team leads. I hate IT and my computer they make it super diffiult to do my job but my TL and supervisor have worked with me so it won't effect my efficiency since it's all out of my control. I feel that because I get so much done compared to everyone else on my team that I'm held to a high standard. I don't feel as appreciated at times cause I have no motivation to do things cause all I get is a pat on the back and told to keep it up without any type of incentive to stay this productive while nothing is happening to my coworkers. They care to much about activities and we have SO many pointless meetings. I am starting to loose my motivation to stay so efficient. I don't like how I'm forces to take breaks or else I get a write up. I HATE how overtime is almost always approved in EVERY departmetn except my department.

I feel that with a lot of the department changes that the Managers will let people know that something may happen in the future with out giving definitive on what exactly the change is going to be or how we can prepare our teams for the changes and then when the change is rolled out there isn't any preparation time given and it makes the team Supervisors and Leads to figure out a way to make the change work on the fly.  \\I understand that the Managers are waiting for the changes to be approved; but, once they are immediately goes into effect.\\   Also it seems that when there is an incentive like what the CAD Department had a couple of weeks ago there is very little announcement time as the incentive email was sent out on a Thursday at 2:46pm. Which is after the morning shift has gone home for the day meaning and only finds out about it the next day.  This has reduced the amount of people who would come in on those extra incentive days than if they were given even a few days notice instead of one day. Many people by that time have made plans for the weekend and are unable to change those plans as they have either already paid some for their weekend plan or made obligations otherwise that they need to keep.  The whole purpose of this incentive program was to get more designs done but due to how late in the week it was announced prevented the incentive from maximizing the amount of people it could have brought in.\\   For a different incentive program that was run in September a list of prizes that could be won.  This one also was announced late as the email that began it was sent out on the Monday it started at 9:05pm; pretty much making it so no one on either shift was really ready for it and the morning shift really missed out on being able to put in any extra time that Monday or the Tuesday afterward since they didn't receive the email until Tuesday morning making it impossible for them to get enough designs to qualify for any of the prizes they really wanted.  \\   Another thing that came out of the September incentive was that it wasn't announced that the winners of any of the prizes would have had to pay taxes on the prizes they won until November 24th when they were sent a tax form to fill out for the prizes they received.  The people on my team were understanding that it does fall into that area that they should need to pay taxes on it after I explained to them that it was what Vivint Solar was supposed to do and that other companies I had worked for also had prizes similar to what they received be considered taxable gifts; but, they were still upset about not being notified about it until almost two months after the September incentive had ended and they had already received their prizes.\\   So to really sum up the real long explanation of the above is that if there are changes or events that are needing to be done there should be given time between the approval of the change/event and to when that change/event is rolled out.
Some of my answer's do not  reflect Vivint as a company but MD-2 office in general.Please contact me for further  input. Thanks.

Mr. Butterfield, \\Questions 1: "Moving in the right direct"\I certainly feel like VSLR is moving in the right direction. I think that there is some frustration from a "process" standpoint  at the office level, but I believe that can be contributed to growing pains. \\Questions 2: "I am committed to the company" \I had to answer Neither Agree no Disagree. I am nothing but committed to this company. However, I have tendered my resignation effective 12/31/2015 to pursue other opportunities. I felt that if I did not capitalize on this opportunity I would regret it in the long run. It was the hardest decision I have had to make. \\Questions 3: "Pride"\I am incredibly proud to work here, I constantly dawn Vivint attire where ever I go. \\Question 4: "Passion" \I love what Vivint is doing, and I love the people I work with,  that is one of the things that made my decision so difficult. \\Questions 5: "Excited to work" \This is one of the only jobs I have ever had where I look forward to coming to work every morning. I love to problem solve.\\Questions 6: "I am a part of the company"\I feel like Bruce Scott (Dir. Ops), Ed Quist(Reg. Ops MD), and Mark Toone (Dir. Sales) have done an amazing job including me on big decisions. I feel like my input is valued, which certainly makes me feel like I am apart of something here. This is another reason I love coming to work here. \\Question 7: "Encourage others to join Vivint"\I personally relocated from FL to pursue a career with Vivint in MD. I have attempted to persuade others to join me but with no luck, that is a big move. I have tried to encourage everyone I have worked with here to pursue every opportunity they can with Vivint to further grow with the company. \\I hope this helps, feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions or if you would like any more in put.

Questions 4: "Necessary Resources"\We deal with a great deal of information. Prior to the dashboard rolling out we were tracking all of our own metrics in Excel. I sent an extensive email to Dan Rock requesting an additional monitor, keyboard, and mouse to help with data entry and analysis. I felt like two screens was absolutely necessary. To my surprise my request was denied. Approximately a month later, I brought this up to our DMs (Jordan Laplace), without hesitation Jordan took care of the situation and ordered them for us and got it taken care of. He provided both my OM and myself with what we needed.\\Questions 7: "Info from my direct supervisor"\My direct supervisor is in the midst of migrating to a new office. For a while we had no regional so I was relying on Bruce Scott (Dir. Ops) to keep me in the loop. He did all he could and did a good job. The additional of our new regional has greatly improved this process. \\Question 8: "Regularly informed"\I hear more from word of mouth than actual emails. I am the Assistant OM for MD1. I rely on my OM for feedback. However, he is in the midst of relocating to another office. The hiring process for the new OM has been longer than I would have ever expected. Ed Quist has been vital in keeping me in the loop since he has joined the team. Go ED!!

I have one concern that has been bothering me about my pay. I am a foreman and I make 27 dollars an hour as of now. However, I know other foreman in this company who are making 33 dollars an hour. They work in a lower cost of living area so that argument is not valid here. I don't understand why I have such a big pay gap even though I have the same position. Just my thoughts.

Many people view us as a joke, but they have no idea what goes into what we do.

Each department is unified in itself. My previous department was solar solutions and we were a tiny team but we loved and helped out one another. I am with Electrical Service Change now and the team here is awesome also they are unified and though i still feel like the outcast because i am new to the team, it is ok i just have to remember to be a part of the team. \The reason why I am sharing this with you is because everyone is team and loves their team but the company does not work as a team. It is because of this, that i was not able to mark any of my answers as "strongly agree". Inbound cares about inbound, fleet performance cares about fleet, billing only deals with billing, sales rep do not care about us they only want their install to go through. There are so many individuals that notice where money is being "used up" that want to prevent this from happening so profit and succeed. \The two thing that i have since noticed being with Vivint Solar that need to change for vivint solar to succeed is unity as a company as a whole and policies to prevent the spending of money.

Communication is key to any successful relationship.\I have been to quite a few job interviews and have been given the job on the spot not because of my resume but because of my personality. I am passionate about my work and know that when i set my mind to it, i can accomplish anything.I do not take the all the credit when i succeed, i have to give credit to my team. For example i use to work for Macy's and i use to sell people on getting a Macy's credit card. I was good at my job but i was only good because my team would motivate me to continue performing and excelling at what i was doing. The company had a goal and they would let the stores know and the stores would let each person know what they expect from each person and each person was require to tell their supervisors what they expected from them to help them reach their goals and grow. In my current team we have weekly meeting on policies and procedures but i have not received an interview about my current performance and what they would like for me to do. In my previous position in solar solutions, My supervisor would say he would meet with us but he never did. I remember when he would meet with us, i would see what i was accomplishing and where i needed to improve on. He would check to make sure we were ok mentally, physically and emotionally. That is a true supervisor, someone that motivates their team and not just someone that deals with escalated customers or situations. Vivint Solar stated that they want to see people excel especially from within well what are they doing to help us accomplish such a thing? In order for someone to know how well he or she is doing they need the one on ones with their supervisors, team meeting need to consist of what we have done, what they want from us, how they want it done and what will this do if we do it. Team goals will motivate the team to strive for something each person given a goal to reach the team goal and the team goal will help contribute to the company goal.\The company is public and we perform on a quarterly bases but what is wanted to be done for that quarter and how is each team going to contribute for that quarterly goal. What is being asked of me?\I have never heard of what the company wants to accomplish that quarter and if the executives want to achieve something they need to notify us of what that is so we may know how we can contribute as a team and then as an individual.\A quote from i love is "by small and simple things are great things brought to pass."

Do you know your employees? Do you know their names and interests? At the moment we are separated and you are located in lehi and i am in Orem. You are not able to come down here everyday and see us and get to know your employees that make Vivint Solar what it is. \My name is Alan Cruz, I am from McKinney, Texas. I have a lovely wife whose name is Amanda Marie Cruz and she is from Clovis, CA and we have been married for almost a year on December 27, 2014. We posted a wedding announcement for everyone to see on my wall in my cubicle and handed some out through out the company and people posted them on their walls. I remember sending one to Mr. Butterfield and to the executives trying to see if i could get a gift for it but my wife said they are at the top of the totem pole they won't care about me since i am at the bottom. I looked at my wife and said "they may be the gears of this operation but i am the oil that makes it smooth for them to operate. " \This year has been a hard one for my wife and i, My wife lost one of her grandmothers this year, i lost an aunt and a grandfather and my twin. We have been trying to have a baby but had two miscarriages  this year. The good news is that we are preganant right now and this baby looks like he is going to make it. My wife is at 16 weeks and counting.\The reason why i am sharing this with you is because i think that as the executives of the company, i would like to know who you are and want you to know who i am. Again one of my favorite jobs was Macy's and they partner with some many people and one is Michael Kor and Tommy Hilfiger. I remember when The CEO of Bloomingdale, Michael Kor and Tommy Hilfiger came and wanted to meet our store. When asked why, they responded, "we just wanted to meet the people that made Macy's and are making it a success" They shook our hands and actually came around and met every department and saw was being done and gave their advice on how to make it better. It was awesome to hear what i was doing for the company and what we can do better. They came on someone's birthday also and brought that person a gift.\Again, Communication is the key to any successful relationship.
This is my last day of work here.  It has been a good experience.  I'm grateful to have had this opportunity!

I don't feel the Vivint solar culture involves my family enough. Families are everything. They are not only why I do what I do, but why our company is doing what we do. I feel the culture here caters to more college age/ single demographics. I'd like to see more opportunity for my family to receive experiences with the company.

When it comes to what is expected of me and my team I know very clearly what is expected of us and me. We have had a lot of set backs recently, like workorders and AB CADS being halted. we have also just recently had monitors taken away. Its easy to feel unappreciated or even forgotten by corporate when adjustments like this keep happening.

The culture in the office has changed a lot. It's sometime uncomfortable. I think since were discouraged from talking about negative things, a lot of us aren't doing as well as they're making it out to be. I'm not even making minimum wage right now and I've been here six months struggling. I get the help from coworkers but it's very difficult to get someone higher to help me other than the extra training, that I've consistently attended. I'm just about at the end of my rope and I'm hoping I can hold on long enough to see an improvement in myself and in my production. I do love my job and I love the idea of having a better life for my family, but I feel like as much time as I'm putting in, I'm failing. I'm worried.
All though I love our company it still feels as though it is separated into compartments.
The reason I disagreed with the resource question is we do not offer all avenues for customers in our area.

I truly feel we do not have a great communication line from top to bottom. We are not acting like a billion dollar business from top to bottom. I have worked for vivint for 5 years. This is the first time I actually doubted what the leadership is doing.

I feel the company is moving in the right direction and creating a lot of opportunities for growth as a company. With the prospecting merge of Sun Edison our residential market is going to increase. \                I would agree that I am committed to Vivint Solar because I am looking forward to the unexpected opportunities. I want to help lead the revolution by being part of Vivint Solar! I have been deciding on how I can contribute more to cause. \                I am proud to work for Vivint Solar because solar energy is going help our future generations in so many ways. Being part of something that will impact and change the future is everyone's dream .\                 I am excited to come to work because my team is amazing and supportive. I am aware of what is expected of me and at times it does feel like it is a big load and a lot of information. We push and support each other to achieve goals and provide a great customer experience.\           I feel like I can do my job effectively and successfully with the resources that have been given. \           I do understand what we need to do in order to succeed as a company but there is confusion at times between the departments.\          My team has a healthy competitive drive and this has helped us achieve goals.
I just want you to know that I am looking forward to what the future has to offer and growth.
The culture and enthusiasm are something that draws me in a career.  Vivint Solar definitely is a place that fosters both.
I appreciate the communication's from Greg.  However, it would be helpful to know more about what is going on and future plans of the business.
I realize Vivint Solar is a big company, so communication is difficult.  However, I feel we could do a better job communicating strategies across business units.

While I am not working in what I would necessarily consider my career, I do enjoy what I do.  I do wish that we could get some funding for higher quality computer equipment.  While the computers we have work adequately, I think we could save anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes per design with upgraded computers.

We could use better computers as a resource to help us be successful.  Co-workers seem about 60/40 where 60% are aiming for quality work and 40% are pushing to get what they're working on out.  I often feel like there is a lack of communication within the company because changes that can be pretty important to my job often don't make it to me for months, and when they do I discover that not even my supervisor knew about the pertinent information.

Not to be too repetitive, but I really think that investing in better computers would pay for themselves in the design department within the 1st year.  I probably spend an average of 10 - 30 minutes per design waiting for things to load on my computer and when designs are taking between 2 and 3 hours that's a pretty significant chunk and could mean as much as 1 more design completed per designer every day.

I am excited to see where Vivint.Solar is headed. Although some are nervous about the merger, I am confident we will be fine with or without it. I know morale can take a hit when hard business decisions have to be made, but these will only help to provide the future that VS is committed to. I appreciate my job and I am forever grateful for the opportunity it has provided me with to serve others and provide for my family.
A state of the union type address from corporate providing insight into our future would go a long way towards improving morale I think.
I like my job but I feel like I am over looked in the solar workout team/billing department.

I feel like I am given new responsibility daily on top of what I already do. We are told we are doing something wrong in our meetings but was never informed we should of been doing that task. We fix the mistakes of others and have tons of responsibility to fix those problems but we our over looked and paid less than other departments who have less work.

Over all I feel like this department does not have a set responsibility. We our always being updated on things that we're changed a week ago. For example a week ago we were all told the Payment team would be taking over the emails in a week. That next week I was still doing emails. I asked my Supervisor why we were still doing emails at the end of that week. She informed me then that we would have to finish catching up on emails before we sent that over the the payment team. We have over 500+ emails in our box it has been that way for the past 4 months. We have less workers than ever (5) and have more to do than I have ever had in this department. I understand we are having a lot of changes in our department but it would be nice to understand exactly what my supervisor and her bosses would like us to do. Just work on emails? Just work on our outbound calls? All the feed back I get is work on emails stop making calls, or work on outbound stop working on emails. We have been told in meetings by Cent with our supervisor there that our department should be working with our most escalated customers to help them and get them paid off. That is our responsibility. We our given  our escalated customers to work with but have no time to call out to them or help them because we are doing emails to paid off/happy customers and working on other departments mistakes. I'm here to work hard. I would just like some direction and to stop having my department be looked over. \\PS: For some reason we are filling out Volume Tracking sheets. These thing are horrible. I really like my supervisor but having someone peer over my shoulder to look at my numbers for the day is very annoying. Everyone in this department has been here for 6 months+ I feel like we all know how to do our jobs correctly and effectively. No one else in the company has to fill these out. I feel like I have a baby sitter rather than a boss. \\Like I said in the questions you asked I like coming to work. I like this job. I like my bosses. I just feel like we need improvements as quickly as possible so that we can work with the escalated customers to help them get paid off.

I love working at Vivint. There are so many great people that I work with who are dedicated and make the environment a fun place. Each week something exciting and new is announced and I have a huge sense of pride in what we do. I look forward to coming into work, which is not something I felt with other jobs. However, I sometimes feel that the OAs are forgotten about. For example, we were not included in the Megawatt trip until last minute. Even then, there is only one spot for an OA on the trip. We used to have a direct voice in the corporate office, but there is no one to really turn to at this point. Every OA I have met works as hard as possible, but it seems like we aren't a part of the team as much as sales or the tech side.

We have a lot of resources that are available to us to help us work efficiently, but they are a little disjointed. We have to go to several different sites to accomplish different tasks. It's not really detrimental, but it would be nice to streamline the system a bit. And to be able to customize Salesforce for individual offices (since each region has such different needs) would be very helpful. I also sometimes feel out of the loop for new information. The merger is something that is definitely a source of uncertainty, and, while I understand that not all information can be shared, it would be nice to have a little more reassurance on what to expect. Also, as an OA, I would really love to be able to give raises to my Permit Specialist, but I don't know who to turn to in order to request this. Since we are not part of one corporate office, it is more difficult to find answers on things like this. I sometimes feel like we are on our own to find out information to a certain extent (and as such, some misinformation is spread occasionally).

Thank you for the weekly conference calls. They definitely help to keep us on the same page. I am very excited to work for this company, in a time where solar is just beginning to boom - it feels like being a little part of history. I love this company's culture and that we are still so young compared to many other companies, because it feels like each of us can make a difference, not just be bogged down by bureaucracy. I hope to stay at Vivint for a long time (a company 401k match would seriously help that as well!).

As happy as we are to come in to work, we are often given jobs that aren't ours to complete that adds on to the workload that we already have. It would be nice to have a structured idea of what it is specifically we are doing pertaining to our job titles. Also, rate of pay needs to be re-evaluated. An amount of money made in one state is not enough in another state. I think that that should be addressed so that we aren't stressing over our hourly pay. The amount alot of the employees are currently making aren't enough to live full lives effectively because we are living paycheck to paycheck, because the areas we live in in order to be close to the office have expensive rent. Some of us, live as far as an hour away from our offices and still struggle from day to day between paychecks.
nothing i can say on the company, I feel good on everything on orders and doing it.
